intro: Gundelia aragatsi, commonly known as Armenian gumweed, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Armenia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gundelia aragatsi is adapted to rocky, arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
